root: ^Never forget where you come from, my child. Your roots shape who you are, but how you grow is up to you. What do your roots mean to you?

s: ^They remind me of the struggles we’ve overcome as a family.
^They make me want to leave this place and never look back.
^I’m not sure, Gran. Sometimes I wish I wasn’t tied to them.

Family_Struggles: ^That’s a good way to see it. Our struggles make us stronger, but they’re also a reminder of what we can achieve. What do you want to achieve for our family?

s: ^I want to build a future where we don’t have to struggle anymore.
^I want to honour the sacrifices that brought us this far.

Build_Better_Future: ^That’s a noble goal. Use our story as a foundation, and build something greater.
Honour_Sacrifices: ^Honouring sacrifices is a beautiful way to show gratitude. Never forget the ones who came before you.
Leave_Without_Looking_Back: ^I understand that feeling. But remember, you can leave without forgetting. What do you think you’ll carry with you when you go?

s: ^The hope that I’ll never have to come back.

Carry_Lessons: ^That’s all I could ask for. Take those lessons and let them guide you wherever you go.
Carry_Hope: ^Hope can be a strong motivator, but don’t let it make you bitter. Use it to inspire, not to run away.
Wish_Not_Tied: ^It’s okay to feel that way. Sometimes roots feel like chains, but they can also be anchors. What do you wish was different about your roots?

s: ^I wish they gave me more opportunities to succeed.
^I wish they didn’t hold me back so much.

Wish_More_Opportunities: ^Opportunities may be limited, but they’re not impossible. You can create your own, no matter where you started.
Wish_Not_Held_Back: ^Feeling held back is hard, but sometimes those roots give you strength in ways you don’t see right now. Don’t let them stop you from growing.
